description: Tim Berners-Lee writes a proposal called “Information Management.” It becomes the World Wide Web.
detail: A Supreme Court decision could fundamentally alter the regulation of speech on the internet.

description: The Dutch first use metal blades on ice skates. In the winter, their frozen canals became high-speed highways.
detail: Chicago's ice rink in Millennium Park was not as sturdy, melting in February because of the heat.

description: Soldiers mutiny against Congress in Philadelphia, seeking back pay. Lawmakers flee and decide to place the capital on federal land.
detail: Pennsylvania is planning a task force to prevent election intimidation and disruption.

description: Unhappy with the slow tempo, a music executive tries to stop Louis Armstrong from recording his next song: "What a Wonderful World."
detail: A new musical about Armstrong — called, yes, "A Wonderful World" — will debut on Broadway this fall.

description: Studying to become a doctor, Frida Kahlo is hospitalized after a bus accident. To occupy herself, she begins to paint.
detail: Kahlo's work is often associated with Surrealism, which turns 100 this year.

description: Angering his hospital, Sidney Farber first uses chemicals to treat kids with leukemia. Some enter bried remission, showing the promise of chemotherapy.
detail: Young women with breast cancer can face a difficult choice: Chemotherapy may help save their lives, but keep them from having children.

description: Deeply religious, John Wanamaker wants this clothing store to be moral and honest. To avoid haggling, he adopts a simpler system: price tags.
detail: The fast food chain Wendy's said it would test "dynamic pricing" for its fast food, adding later that is had no plans to raise prices during busy periods.

description: The printing press first arrives near Rome. Instead of heavy German lettering, Italians will develop more readable fonts, including roman and italic.
detail: One Italian typeface, Bodoni, has become ubiquitous, and is probably lurking in your bookshelf.

description: After 200 years of construction delays, a cathedral's bell tower - still leaning - is completed in Pisa
detail: Egyptian plans to resurface an ancient pyramid have drawn criticism, and were compared to straightening the Tower of Pisa.
